nodes.text: Green/Aura was an Imperial Navy IPV-1 System Patrol Craft, and, alongside the IPV-1 Green/Besh and the Lancer-class frigate Rage, was stationed in the year 0 ABY at the Imperial Bavos-II military space platform Station 1B6/Green on the edge of the Mid Rim's Ringali Nebula. As an IPV-1 measuring 150 meters long and produced by the company Sienar Fleet Systems, the Green/Aura could reach a speed of one thousand kilometers per hour, was armed with four turbolasers, and acted as an inter-system patrol and customs craft.

The Green/Aura was first mentioned in 1998's The Far Orbit Project, by Timothy S. O'Brien. The book was a supplement to West End Games's Star Wars: The Roleplaying Game and was a sequel of sorts to the previous publication Pirates & Privateers, carrying on that book's theme by following the privateering EF76 Nebulon-B escort frigate Far Orbit. Players could attack Station 1B6/Green with the Far Orbit as a part of the scenerio hook "Who Is The More Foolish…?". If they did, the Green/Aura would most likely defend the station.
